title: Nate the Great: The Fleeing Fang
author: Marjorie Weinman Sharmat

book_level.description: Early reader level - simple mystery about a detective solving a case

questions.question: What is the main character's name?

options.B: Fang

questions.explanation: The main character introduces himself as Nate the Great, a detective.

questions.question: What is the name of Nate's dog?

options.B: Sludge

questions.explanation: Nate's dog is named Sludge, and he is also a detective.

questions.question: Why are Nate's friends throwing him a party?

options.B: He solved many cases for them

questions.explanation: They are having a Detective Party because Nate has solved so many cases for them.

questions.question: Whose dog ran away?

options.B: Rosamond's

questions.explanation: Fang is Annie's dog, and he ran away before the party.

questions.question: What food does Nate love to eat?

options.B: Pancakes

questions.explanation: Nate the Great loves pancakes. Pancakes help him think.

questions.question: How many cats does Rosamond have?

options.B: Three

questions.explanation: Rosamond has four cats: Super Hex, Big Hex, Little Hex, and Plain Hex.

questions.question: What did Annie do to clean Fang instead of giving him a bath?

options.B: Feather-dusted him

questions.explanation: Annie didn't have time for a bath, so she feather-dusted Fang.

questions.question: When the two tiny poodles barked at Fang, he ran away because ---.

options.B: Annie accidentally gave him a command to go to the park

questions.explanation: When Annie said 'bark, bark, bark' to shoo the poodles, Fang thought it was a command because 'bark' rhymes with 'park' in his training.

questions.question: Annie trained Fang using a rhyming book, but Fang mixed up the commands so ---.

options.B: he did the line that rhymed instead of the correct action

questions.explanation: When Annie said one line, Fang did the other rhyming line instead, so she had to say them backwards.

questions.question: The lady with the green hat might be a 'red herring' which means ---.

options.B: she seems like a clue but might not be important

questions.explanation: Nate explains a red herring is something that 'seems like a clue but isn't a clue.'

questions.question: Pip saw Fang following a lady in a green hat, but this was ---.

options.A: the key clue to finding Fang
options.B: not the real reason Fang ran away

questions.explanation: Although Fang was seen behind the lady, he wasn't really following her - he was going to the park.

questions.question: Nate figured out the real clue when Sludge started ---.

options.B: licking ice cream dripping from the table

questions.explanation: When Sludge licked the dripping ice cream, Nate remembered the rhyme 'lick, lick, lick' and realized the answer.

questions.question: Nate says the first step to finding something missing is to ---.

options.B: remember if there was anything different and where you last saw it

questions.explanation: Nate tells Annie to 'remember if there was anything different' and 'where you last saw him.'

questions.question: Where did Nate find Fang?

options.B: at the park

questions.explanation: Nate found Fang at the park because 'park' rhymes with 'bark.'

questions.question: Why does Nate say Fang wasn't really missing?

options.A: Because Fang was hiding as a joke
options.B: Because Fang went exactly where he thought he was told to go

questions.explanation: Nate says Fang followed the command he thought he heard. It was Annie and Harry who were 'missing' from where Fang expected them.

questions.question: What detective lesson does this story teach about clues?

options.B: Follow everyone you see
options.C: Some clues that seem important might not be real clues (red herrings)

questions.explanation: The lady in the green hat seemed like a clue but wasn't - she was a red herring. The real clue was the rhyming commands.

questions.question: What does Nate mean when he says 'put yourself in a dog's shoes'?

options.B: Think about why a dog might act the way it did

questions.explanation: Nate means detectives should try to understand the missing person's or animal's point of view.

questions.question: Why was Fang asleep when Nate found him at the park?

options.B: He had been waiting for Annie and Harry to come

questions.explanation: Fang went where he thought he was told and waited for Annie and Harry, so he fell asleep waiting.

questions.question: Why does Nate say 'pancakes help him think'?

options.B: It's a funny way of saying he does his best thinking while eating his favorite food

questions.explanation: Nate takes time to eat and think calmly, and pancakes are his favorite food that helps him focus.

questions.question: What is the main lesson about communication in this story?

options.B: Misunderstandings happen when words can mean different things

questions.explanation: The whole mystery happened because Annie said 'bark' meaning to shoo poodles, but Fang heard it as a command rhyming with 'park.'
